13231112122.content:
After a thought, you asked, "Will, do you think you can teleport us all to the lair of the Council?"

"I can try." said Will, uncertain. "I just discovered this power, I don't know its limits."

You nodded. "I understand." you said. "Given this new information, I'd say that the council is expecting me to go there in the invisible car and be ready for me."

Inadvertently picking up on your thoughts, Will became suddenly thoughtful. "You're right, the members of the council are just as old, if not older than Scilock." she said. he then became alarmed. "They're looking for fresh talent to keep the organization alive!"

"Brainwashing!" gasped Sarah. "They must have known that you would call for super hero assistance or Megan would have used her powers to call for help!"

Heavy hearted, you nodded. "Either way, I no longer believe that the council of Chaos kidnapped Megan to get Scilock back on their team." you said. "I believe they took her to set a trap..."

"A trap for us." said Violet, swallowing hard.

Suddenly, Will's eyes steeled firm. "Well, let's not disappoint them." he said.

All turned to Will, confused. Only you knew what he was planning. "Forget it will." you scolded, falling into mother mode. "It's far too dangerous."

Will chuckled. "We're super heroes, 'mom'." he said, sarcastically. "Danger is what we do!"

"Besides, you called us for help, remember?" added Jack, smiling.

"Yes, I did." you replied. "Only that was before I realized the council's true intentions..."

"We are going to get your daughter and husband back and bring the council down on our way out!" said violet, sternly, placing her hands onto her hips. "You can either help us or get out of the way!"

You smiled, tearing up slightly. "That was my line, back in the day." you said. "I'm proud of you all, using your powers to help those in danger or in need." you rubbed the tears from your eyes, then steeled them. "Okay, Psychic Boy, what is your plan of attack?"

Will smiled, pleased that you did not try to assume command, then began to spell out his plan. "We will be attacking in two fronts." he began. "Madam Witch, you will be hitting them head on with the invisible car, you will be the diversion, drawing the guards attention and fire. Just be ready with a teleporter, just in case." you nodded. "The rest of us will divide into two teams, one looking for Megan, the other for Scilock..."

"Why?" asked Mary, looking hurt. "Why are you working for such an evil organization?"

"What is evil, Mary?" asked Madam Ice. "It is nothing more than another person's version of 'good'." she sighed. "The world is in chaos, nations at each other's throats, fights in the streets, in our schools... and in our homes."

"There's a guy in there absorbing all Megan's sonic power, making her weak so they can brainwash her" said Will "Lets get him" Violet expanded a forcefield inside the lock, breaking it without a sound. "I put a forcefield inside him, he's trying to absorb the energy from there but he's just absorbing his own energy back into himself, I can expand the forcefield and make him explode" she said. choices: continue, Will and Violet wanting answers.
13231112122221222111.content:
Megan gave Will a warm hug then turned and gave Violet a hug as well. "Thank you for the rescue." she said, shyly.

Then Will heard Megan's thoughts. *He's cute.*

He blushed at that but tried his best to hide it as Megan spoke again. "They said they needed some new recruits in their little circle to continue their work." she said. "I... I'm sorry but I think you all landed into some kind of trap."

"We know." said Violet. "Don't worry, we'll take them down."

Will gave Megan a curious glance, sensing that she was holding something back. "Did any of your captors say anything to you while you were held prisoner?" he asked. "Did you hear them say anything that might help?"

As he waited for Megan to respond, he heard her think, *He's good, no wonder they picked him.*

"No, I didn't hear anything other than they wanting fresh members." said Megan.

Sensing a trap, will sent Violet a telepathic message. "I fear that Megan as already been brainwashed, we need to get her out of here before we do anything else."

Will nodded and was about to place a forcefield around Megan to hold her still when the lights went off and they found themselves being manhandled by powerful metal arms.

"Let me go!" demanded Will.

"Stop, where are you taking us!?" screamed Violet.

Then Will heard Megan's thoughts. "They are in for a surprise..."

Moments later, Will and Violet were roughly dropped inside a dark room where a voice called out, "Welcome Will and Violet, welcome."

The lights then came on and the two found, to their surprise, Scilock, Madam Witch, and a number of other aging super heroes sitting at a long table. "Welcome to the home of the World Academy of Super powered Advanced People." you said with a smile. "You have just passed your entrance exam."

Will and Violet turned to each other, stunned. "This was a test?" asked Will. "Why didn't I read that from your mind?"

You laughed. "I blocked your mind from entering with my magic." you explained. "You two have passed, let's see if the others are as successful." she turned to Megan. "You know where to go and what to do, dear." she said.

Megan giggled. "Okay, mom." she said.

With that, she vanished from view while you turned back to Will and Violet. "Watch the monitors and see how well they do in their entrance exam."
13231112122221222111.title: Continue with Will, Violet and Megan

132311121222212221112.content:
Watching Jack lead his group into another part of the compound with Madam Ice and Animorph, Will asked, "Why this deception, we came to help you and it was nothing but a test?"

"My wife did not know it was a test either until she passed." explained Max. "You see, it takes more than special powers and an attitude to be a super hero, you have to be able to think fast on your feet, willing to take a beating to save an innocent person's life..." he sighed. "I can tell you from experience that super heroes have died trying to save the day."

Violet swallowed hard. "We are aware of that." she said.

"You need to be more than just aware of it, young lady." you said, seriously. "This is not a game you can start over if something goes wrong which is why we have decided to recruit and train you so that you will be ready when the new Council of Chaos strikes again."

Suddenly Will chuckled. "So you lured us to WASAP."

Max chuckled himself. "I laughed at the name of this school as well but I assure you, it's teachings are very serious and you will meet other rising super heroes from around the globe who are all lured here and to other schools, such as Sky High or Xavier's school for the gifted to learn the art of saving the day."

"The world's nations are slowly disintegrating into chaos, you can guess who is behind it." you said. "We are all getting too old to continue this line of work, we need fresh heroes to handle this new global crisis but we must me sure that they are prepared to take it head on." you then smiled. "I will be your teacher..."

Will and Violet both nodded then turned to the monitors as Jack found Megan being 'stripped' of her powers...
132311121222212221112.title: continue, Will and Violet wanting answers.

1323111212222122211122.content:
Once everyone had been gathered once more, you escorted them to a large room where four other kids were siting around talking among themselves. "Good morning, class." you said, catching their attention. "I would like you to meet your other students, they just finished the entrance exam."

"Welcome to Wasap." said a small girl with a slight greenish skin tone, blond hair and blue eyes. "I'm Samantha Banner, my hero name is Hulka."

"Hulk with a feminine twist." said Jack, smiling. "I like it. I'm Jack, my hero name is Fly boy."

Hulka turned her head, slightly. "Is that all you can do.. fly?" she asked.

Jack was taken back. "I... I'm not sure." he replied, blushing slightly. "I just got my powers a few days ago."

Hulka giggled. "Don't worry, more powers will come to you." she said. "Only you won't be a boy forever, I'd think of something else as your powers grow."

Jack nodded. "I'll give it some thought."

What's shaking?" said a muscular boy with sand brown hair and brown eyes. "I'm Ben Grimm Jr. My hero name is Rockman, pleased to meet you."

Will took his hand and shook it. "I'm Will, my hero name is Psychic boy." she said. "Forgive me but, you don't seem to have your father's... err... distinctive armor."

Ben grinned. "I can summon it at will." he replied. "I agree with Hulka, drop the boy part,." he paused. "Try Psychio."

Will made a face. "Nah, not my style." he said. "Thanks, though, I'll stick with the name I picked."

Then Violet stepped forward and introduced herself to a small boy in dark shades who had remained silent since they had walked into the room. "Hey, I'm Violet." she said, offering her hand. I use my own name as my hero name as well."

The boy looked up at her and nodded. "I'm Paul." he said. "Paul Summers, at your service. My hero name is Shockwave, I have the mental powers of my mom, Jean and the energy blasts of my dad, Cyclops."

"You seem to be a cool character." said Mary, curious. "is it because your energy blasts are psychic in origin?"

Paul nodded. "Exactly." he replied. "I have to stay calm at all times to keep my powers under control."

"My hero name is Pyra." said Mary. "I have to stay relatively calm as well or I... ignite."

Paul nodded. "I can give you a few pointers if you like.

Mary blushed, giving Paul a small grin. "I'd appreciate that." she said.

"I'm Sarah." said the last girl of the new group. "My hero name is Mirage. I can become anyone with all of their knowledge and their powers, if they have any."

"Sounds like a cool power to have." said a girl, just now coming into view. "I'm Erica Stark, daughter of Tony Stark. My hero name is Iron Maiden."

"I will allow you all to get to know each other better." you said, leaving the room. "Classes start tomorrow."

With that, you left the room to meet your daughter, Megan. "Can I join the class, mommy?" she asked.

You sighed, shaking your head, and replied...
1323111212222122211122.title: Your class of young super heros.

13231112122221222111222.content:
Sorry, Megan, you're still a little too young." you said, wincing. "That and your magical ability to create anything from nothing is still very weak." you placed a hand onto her shoulder as she teared up. "You can join up next year, I promise."

"But I want to join now!" whined Megan. "I played the role of the 'damsel in distress', like you asked. "didn't that earn me at least something?"

You sighed. "I did promise her a reward for her help in this." you thought. "Alright, Megan, I'll let you sign up on a probation period." you said, finally. "If you are unable to keep up with the rest of the class, I will not hesitate to pull you out for your own safety until next year."

Megan giggled, hugging you. "Thanks, mom!" she said. "I won't let you down!"

You smiled. "You can never let me down, pumpkin." you said, roughing up her long hair. "Just try not to get hurt too badly."

With that said, you magically added Megan's name to the list of students in your class and ushered her in to join the first lesson of the day. What is the first lesson?

1323111212222122211122222.content:
"This is your first test, Megan." summoning her forward, I said. "Show us how you prefer to use your powers."

Megan cleared her throat. "I have the magical power to create anything and control it through of sheer will." nervously, she began. "Everything I make is made out of magic and mental energies."

"How do you intend to use this power and what would you like your hero name to be?" guiding Megan, I asked. "Be specific as it will be the name we will be calling you throughout the school year."

Megan smiled, producing a deck of Sorcery playing cards. Sorcery was like any other dueling card game only each deck was geared for a specific character you play in the game. The draw of the card and how you played them determined if your character prevails in his or her quest or fails. There are several dozen characters, each with their own deck, making it the most complex and intense quest card game in the world. It also came with a map and a log to keep track of each mission as the games continue towards the end of their quest.

"I am Lady Quest." he voice echoing, Megan replied.

With that, she drew a card from the deck and she became an adult female warrior with armor that reminded me of the legendary Valkyrie warriors. Megan then drew her sword and gave an impressive display of skill and precision before returning to her normal form.

"Impressive." smiling, Will said. "Can you become any character from that game?"

"I can become a girl version of any character in the game." smiling, Megan corrected. "I can also bestow powers from the deck I use to any member of my team for a short while."

"Amazing!" smiling, Iron Maiden said. "I wouldn't mind dueling you sometime, just to see what you can do!"

"Why not now?" motioning Iron Maiden to step forward. "Once I am clear, you may begin."

Iron maiden activated her high tech armor while Megan summoned her female warrior character. They circled each other for a moment, looking for an opening. Who made the first strike?

Does she take his advice?

Lady Quest, not knowing of the message Iron Maiden, saw Erica fall and quickly pulled a card from slot in the armor of her left hand. "Hand of mercy!" tossing the card, she exclaimed.

The card glow for a second then seemed to explode in a puff of smoke with a large ghostly hand appearing in its place. Erica was surprised to be caught by the hand and safely lowered to the floor. Only the duel was not over yet as she commanded her armor to attack Lady Quest. Indeed, Quest was taken off guard but she recovered quickly and, while holding the animated armor at bay, she summoned a card with her voice. "Ghost armor!"

As the two empty suits battled it out, Megan cancelled her own armor and sat down next to Erica. "Two can play at this game, Erica." smiling, she said. "My armor is going to kick your armor's buttocks."

You giggled. "No fight is fair but you must know your opponent." smiling, you said. "Erica has not seen Megan in battle before but Megan has seen Iron Man in action so she has an idea of some of her moves."

Who wins?
132311121222212221112222221.title: Card play.

1323111212222122211122222211.content:
As her Iron Maiden armor continued to fight the Ghost Armour, Erica considered her options. Along with her Iron Maiden armor, she had several blasters concealed on her person. She could use these to distract Megan and force her to divert her attention from the fight. Subtly drawing her blaster, she fired a warning shot passed Megan. She lost her focus on the Ghost Armour as she threw herself backwards. Erica drew a second blaster and fired shots into the ground, forcing Megan back. Megan regained her focus. The Ghost Armour lunged through the air towards Erica. It brought its arm up and made to punch Erica. The fist hit a wall and a ripple went across the air in a sphere around Erica.

"Your first mistake," said Erica "Was thinking that my armor held all my powers."
"Your second, was letting your anger get the better of you," The Ghost Armour continued to punch the force field. Looking on, Megan, didn't notice the Iron Maiden armor hovering behind her. It dropped to the ground, muffling it's fall with two miniature force fields. The armor put one arm around Megan's neck, pointing its weapons at Megan's head.
"Your final mistake, was forgetting that you had two opponents, not just one," Erica finished "This fight is over, retract your cards."
Megan closed her eyes and shrunk down, returning to her normal form. The Ghost Armour vanished.
"I have to say, Megan," said Erica "I'm impressed."
"Why are you impressed?" asked Megan "I lost."
"What do you think training is for?" asked Erica "To learn from your mistakes, remember that an enemy's most powerful weapon may not be their only one, and remember to be aware of everything, don't let yourself become too focused on one battle, then maybe next time we spar, you might beat me."
"You really think I could beat you?" asked Megan.
Erica nodded "You almost did today, you know more about my powers now, and I only know a fraction of yours, your unpredictability is your greatest advantage, that's how I beat you, I was just as unpredictable and this threw you off guard, that's another lesson, never let down your guard."
"Thank you for the sparring session," said Megan "I learned a lot."

Violet created small force bubbles and threw them at the robots, knocking many of them to the ground, then amplified Will's powers so he could teleport the civilians out of the area.
As you watched this, Hulka asked "I thought you told them to stick to the two teams you split them into."
"I simply told them the jobs they were assigned while inside the simulator," you say "How they divide those tasks is up to them, you have to remember that they are used to working in a team whereas you are not, they know each other's strengths and weaknesses, and they have even incorporated new powers they have learned recently into their fighting style, that is how a team should work, playing to each other's strengths and covering each others weaknesses."
"I think I see," said Shockwave "Will's psychic powers wouldn't be much use against the robots as they don't have minds, but amplifying his teleporting ability with the help of Violet allows him to teleport civilians out of the area in large numbers, in the meantime, he is protected by Violet's forcefield power."
"Very good," you said "You've been getting extra lessons from your parents, haven't you?"
Shockwave said nothing, but you saw that he was smiling shyly, a clear sign that he had gotten extra lessons.
"They taught you well," you say "If they wouldn't mind, I'd like if they could come in at some point as guest instructors, could you ask them?"
"Yeah sure," said Shockwave "I can ask them."
"I'll have to get in contact with Jack and Violet's parents as well," you muttered to yourself "They would also be good guest instructors."
You turned back to the simulation just as the last of the civilians were evacuated from the area. Then, the four of them concentrated all their powers on destroying the last of the robots. Once that was done, they left the simulation room.
1323111212222122211122222211221.title: The simulation begins.

choices: They need help, Violet jumps in.
13231112122221222111222222112211.content:
"Well done, team!" smiling, you said. "You saved all of the civilians and stopped all of the robots cold!"

"Thank you, Madam Witch." blushing slightly, Violet said. "Was there anything that needs improvement?"

"Your reaction time." serious, you said. "The next simulation may not allow you any time for hesitation."

Violet sighed. "Yes ma'am." sadly, she said.

"Hey, you did great out there." lightly touching her shoulder, you said. "I learned all of my lessons the hard way, many a times I ended up in a private hospital. I want to spare you some of those harsh lessons."

"Thanks." finding her smile, Violet said.

You smiled back then turned to Hulka and Rockman. "This next simulation is for Hulka and Rockman alone." firmly, you said. "I will be playing the villain."

Hulka looked at you surprised. "We are to fight you?" curious, she asked.

"Piece of cake." grinning, Rockman said.

You giggled. "Oh, you think so?" amused, you asked. "The simulation is simple; someone has taken over my mind and I am attacking you both. Your objective is to free me from the mind control by simply removing the disk from my forehead."

"That's it!?" surprised, Violet asked.

"They have to reach me first." smiling, I said.

With that, I placed a disk onto my forehead then sent a mental signal to my husband, Scilock. "Just pick which tricks to use." giggling inside, I thought to him. "They will be expecting me to use my fighting style but not yours."

"As you wish, my little puppet." teasing, Scilock thought back. "Let us see how quickly Hulka and Rockman can adjust to new situations."

With that, the simulation began with Hulka and Rockman inside a large room with you on the opposite side.
How do they fair...?
13231112122221222111222222112211.title: You congratulate them

132311121222212221112222221122111.content:
Both Hulka and Rockman charge at you from different directions, Hulka preparing to jump at you. You felt yourself vanish and appear behind Rockman, who had not yet summoned his rock form, and muttered an incantation, causing Rockman to vanish, appearing in the air at the ceiling of the room. Hulka, seeing her team mate falling, changed course and jumped into the air, catching him just before he hit the ground. You watched as they whispered to each other, but you felt Scilock tapping into your telepathy to hear what they were planning
You know, what you're doing could be considered cheating, you pointed out
You know they need to learn the hard way if at all, replied Scilock, but was cut off as both of you heard Hulka's thoughts as she outlined her plan to Rockman.
...distract her, we can get the disc off her head
Got it, thought Rockman, then, his voice vanished. Looking to him, you saw that he had turned into his rock form. You tried to read his mind again, or at least, Scilock did, but both of you came up against a powerful psychic shield that had not been present before
His rock form is resistant to telepathy, said Scilock's voice in your head Time to take it up a notch.
You felt yourself utter another incantation. To Hulka and Rockman's surprise, you vanished.
Hulka closed her eyes. You padded silently around her guard and made to strike with magic, but before you could, she jumped, somersaulting and kicking your left shoulder, spinning you around. The disc stayed on your head, but your invisibility spell was deactivated, causing you to become visible. Rockman took the opportunity to punch you onto the ground, where both he and Hulka attempted to remove the disk, but before they could, they were hit by a telekinetic blast, throwing both of them into a wall. However, both were immediately up again, and Rockman picked Hulka up and threw her at you. You ducked instinctively as Hulka soared over your head, but she took hold of the disc as she passed. Her momentum managed to pull the telekinetically- locked disc off your head as she continued towards the wall, not slowing down. Right before she hit, you put out your hand and she froze in the air, inches from the wall. The battle had been won
132311121222212221112222221122111.title: They succeed (barely).

1323111212222122211122222211221111.content:
"I wasn't expecting your rock form to be telepathically null," you said "I'm impressed that you used that to your advantage."
Rockman smiled. "Thanks, Madame Witch." You turned to Hulka.
"I'm guessing you were expecting my mind reading," you said, to her nod "That trick you used was a favourite of the Wolverine back in the day, I'll definitely be getting him in as a guest instructor now, that trick would be useful for everyone."
"Thanks Madame Witch," said Hulka "But can I ask a question?"
"Sure thing," you replied
"That disc," said Hulka "In a real battle, would the bad guys really be as stupid as to use a visible disc as a method of mind control, why not use something else, if Mesmero was our enemy for example, or the Mandarin, he could control one of us without even having to use a disc, so what exactly was the point of this exercise?"
"That's a reasonable question," you admitted "it's true that the combat implications of removing a mind control disc from someone's head are limited in this day and age, but as you've proved with that move you did, which, when Wolverine used it, was used to launch him at Sentinels or into combat, you adapted it for the situation, that's why we train, so you are equipped with the skills you need to use in all situations, but the skills themselves are not what we try to teach you, it's how to apply those skills to whatever scenario you're given, and how to work as a team to make sure those skills are used in the best way possible to get the job done."
"Thank you for the lesson, Madame Witch," said Rockman "Thank Scilock as well for us."
You were surprised that Rockman had picked up on Scilock's fighting style, but he pointed up to a control room where Scilock was sitting at the controls. You laughed.
"Another thing you have to be in all situations," she said "Is observant."
1323111212222122211122222211221111.title: A bit of feedback

13231112122221222111222222112211112.content:
"That is a wise piece of advice, Madam Witch." came a familiar voice.

You smiled. "I was wondering when you were going to drop your cloaking device, Iron Man." turning to face the four adults approaching your class."

"I could never sneak up on you, Maria." softly, Iron Man replied. "Still, I keep trying."

You smiled then turned to the others. "Your daughter is showing a lot of potential, Mr Stark." serious, you said. "She still needs to work on her close quarters flying."

Ericka blushed slightly but smiled when her father said, "I had the same problems when I built my first armored suit, give it time."

"Mr. Grim, your son is showing a lot of promise." proudly, you said. "He just needs to work on summoning his armor a bit faster."

"At least he doesn't have it on all the time." with a slight smile, Ben replied. "That was a huge date killer for me before I met the love of my life."

You giggled then turned to the next adult. "Dr Banner, your daughter is showing great potential." smiling, you said. "She is using her intellect as well as her strength."

"That's my girl." smiling, Dr Banner said.

Samantha blushed brightly. "Daddy..."

"How is my son doing?" serious, a tall man asked.

"Mr Summers... Cyclops, your son is doing extremely well, he is exceeding my expectations." equally as serious, you replied. "However, I see a flaw in you."

Mr Summers, AKA Cyclops rose a single eyebrow behind his red tinted glasses. "Oh? What's that?"

"You are only seeing your sons flaws rather than his achievements." irritated, you replied. "So I invited yet another student and parent over to discuss this with you."

As if on cue, a bald man in a floating wheelchair entered the room with a young girl walking at his side. Mr Summers gulped upon seeing them. "Professor Xavier!?" stunned, he asked. "I didn't know you had a daughter."

"She is adopted, Cyclops." calmly, Xavier replied. "Her name is Xena Olivia Xavier."

"Xs and Os." smiling, Xena said. "The simple letters for kisses."

Xavier smiled at her. "Would you mind chatting with the students for a while while I talk with my graduate, my dear?" he asked.

"Okay, daddy." giggling, Xena replied.

She skipped away and walked over to Megan where they began to talk and giggle as Xavier then turned to Cyclops. "You will always be my student, Cyclops." serious, he said. "Do not forget that."
13231112122221222111222222112211112.title: You're interrupted

choices: Go to Mary, Will Jack and Violet
132311121222212221112222221122111121.content:
Xavier led Scott over to an area of semi-privacy.
"You have to stop expecting so much from Shockwave," said Xavier "Think about how he feels: his father is Scott Summers, leader of the X Men, and his , mother is Jean Grey: former host to the Phoenix Force, but he's not Jean, he's not you, and he is not Hope, so don't try to make him them. It won't bring Jean back, and it won't get Hope to forgive you for what you did."
"I was wrong about my actions under the influence of the Phoenix Force," said Scott "I only saw the benefits that we reaped for mutant-kind. It took Hope to make me see the error of my ways. Then, you found Shockwave, my son, though how he even exists, I still don't know. I wanted to do right by him."
,
Xavier wheeled his chair around to look over at Xena. She and Megan were sitting on the ground, a deck of cards in front of each of them, and they seemed to be halfway through a game.
"You're not the only hero to make mistakes," said Xavier "You remember my son, David? I abandoned him when he was very young, he became Legion, a threat to us all. We both have a second chance to do this right, your fear of losing your son is so strong, you're trying to push him to be more powerful than you, Jean and Hope combined. He needs to grow into his own, not into your image of what he should be."
Scott sighed. "You may be right," said Scott "Very well, I will try to see past my son's flaws, and try to praise his victories."
"That is all I ask," said Xavier "Be his father, not his trainer."
132311121222212221112222221122111121.title: continue.

1323111212222122211122222211221111212.content:
Xena was a good player. The deck her character was based on was Galea, The Warrior Priestess, a powerful character which focused on buffing her own vassals while debuffing the enemy, as well as healing herself and her other cards. It's weakness, however, lay in a poor offensive capability normally. The Lady Quest deck packed a much larger punch, but no healing ability, no debuffs and a lot of buffs, but focused on only buffing Lady Quest herself, as well as restraining the enemy. It was a hard-fought duel, but Megan managed to achieve victory.
"Wow," said Megan "You're really good. Where did you learn to play like that?"
"My cousin Dazzler," said Xena "She taught me how to play, and introduced me to other players of the game. Some of them were telepaths, so I had to learn every trick I could in order to beat them. Although I couldn't read their mind, I could anticipate what they were going to do and plan accordingly. That's why Galea is such a good deck for me. It gives me enough options that I can reliably confuse a telepath's senses by thinking really hard about doing one thing, and then doing something else."
"Dazzler the rock star?" asked Megan, then squealed out-loud, and put her hand over her mouth, her face turning red "I love her music. She was one of the first mutants to make it big in the music business."
"I could introduce you at some point if you want," said Xena "She's really cool."
"So if you aren't a telepath, what can you do?" asked Megan, changing the subject to avoid screaming out loud as Xena talked about the opportunity to meet Dazzler.

"Well," said Xena "I can..."
1323111212222122211122222211221111212.title: Go to Megan and Xena

choices: Go to a different group of characters
13231112122221222111222222112211112121.content:
Xena removed her t-shirt, revealing a body covered in tatoos.
"These showed up when I hit puberty," said Xena "I was, punished by the orphanage matrons, and they tried to get rid of the tatoo, but they couldn't. They're apart of me."
"What do they do?" asked Megan, looking at the tattoo of a beautiful butterfly on her hip. Xena looked at where Megan was looking, and smiled.
"Would you like to meet her?" Xena asked. Before Megan could answer, the tatoo began to flap it's wings, as it flew across Xena's body, and down her arm. Splaying her palm as the butterfly came to the end of her arm, her hand glowed as the butterfly flew out of her hand, and began flying towards Megan.
Megan's eyes were wide with wonder, as she brought up her hand to allow the butterfly to land on her.
"Her name is Lazia," said Xena "She says she likes you."
"Hi Lazia," said Megan, softly, then looked at Xena "I thought you said you weren't telepathic?"
"Not with humans," said Xena "But anything I make with my tatoos, I can communicate with. I know it's not cool like laser eyes, or rock skin or telekinesis, but I like it."
"Are you kidding me?" Megan asked "Your powers are amazing. What else can you make?"
Xena closed her eyes, and on her hip, an impression of a small, stylised pen formed, and then, like the butterfly, it flew up to, and then down, her arm, and became real.
"Here," said Xena, smiling "A bit of a souvenir."
"Can we be best friends?" Megan asked "You're awesome."
Xena put her t-shirt back on.
"I thought we already were," said Xena, as she pulled Megan into a hug "Come on, bff. We should volunteer as a team for the next scenario."
13231112122221222111222222112211112121.title: Xena shows off her powers

choices: Call up Bob Thornton and the New Do Wells?
13233.content:
You wait for hours upon hours, and eventually fall asleep. You awaken to the sound of your alarm clock, a small stuffed dragon. You look around and see not a single youthful hero. This pisses you off, so you head over to the so called 'heroes' known as the Do Wells, and see what's going on.

Adorned in a gray jacket and dark gray sweatpants, you jog over to the firehouse where the Do Wells set up shop, only to realize its been replaced by a casino. You see a bum wandering around, and pull him over for questioning.

"Oh... that building? It was eatened up by a Godzilla type creature. Every single superhero was in the place, don't you know. Well, except one... I an't rememberin' which though. You might find a business card somewhere near here."

You investigate the casino stairs, as per the hobo's advice, and you scrounge up a dirty torn slip, reading "Bob Thornton for the New Do Wells! 555-555-5551"

Bob Thornton. Of course. Bob Thornton was the secret identity of the Vet, a hero out of Nam' era that he had taken up during Iraq. He was easily the oldest of the Do Wells, and now it seemed he was the lone survivor. These New Do Wells, however, might just get you the justice you need...
13233.title: Buncha God Damn No Shows

choices: Sure, bring the New Do Wells
132331.content:
Bob is sleazy as always.

"Hey, Stepharoni! Still haven't called back about that swingin' invitation I gave you and Max, huh? Well, it's too late, Glazer and Peregrine took your spots, and the next swingers' party is in Autumn!"

You try to overlook his douchiness, and focus on your problem. After going back and forth with Thornton, you finally get an address for the New Do Wells, the even more youthful team that was to replace the Do Wells, whom were young as well. This exercise made you feel old. You jog over to the address, and see its an apartment building. You enter, give the clerk the passwords Bob told you, and finally you meet the New Do Wells.

And boy, they are some characters.

Heavy Hitter, AKA Jessica Archer, F 19
Jessica's power is super strength, which is both practical and normal for regular heroes. The only thing wrong with Jessica is her utter rage that comes with everything. That, and her being slighlty overweight.

The Animal Kid, AKA Bill Moran, M 25
Bill is consistently shirtless. He doesn't have a distinct power, however he does seem to lack restraint, allowing him to go to more depths that certain minds couldn't think about. His weakness is, he's not very bright.

Righteous Fury, AKA Elissa Berkhauser, F 47
Elissa, older than even I am, was a surprise. She dressed very classily, and didn't seem to partake in the roughhousing of her cohabitants. She has the power to summon electricity, however it is only if she believes what she is doing is align with her beliefs. Weaknesses: Her general brittleness. Also, she believes in Scientology.

Mr. One Inch, AKA Harry Archer, M 19
Harry doesn't really have a power, if you ask me. Harry was born one inch tall, as all of his nutrients were given to his twin sister, Jessica. Harry still remains light hearted, and surprisingly charming. His weaknesses? He can die pretty easily, he's fairly cowardly, and he pisses off Jessica.

Slipknot, AKA Chris Weiss, M 27
He can climb anything.

These five were a curious bunch. They didn't seem to work well together. But, I still needed to save Max. Would they be the people to take with me to the ends of the Earth?
132331.title: Meet the NDW

choices: The New Do Wells slaughter the Council.
The Council of Chaos defeats the NWD.
1323311.content:
Luckily for you and your team, there were only five members of the Council of Chaos, and you had six. Though, the usefulness of Mr. One Inch was in question.

You peered inside, and saw the five villains you remembered.

Johnny Tommy Guns, a mobster with tommy guns for hands.
Jaws, a humanoid shark who kills.
Camerhead Eddie, a sheltered serial killer with a camera mask on his head.
Dex Derby, a knife swinging butler.
Felina, a jaguar furry lady that creeped you out because of how overtly sexual she was.
Scilock, a mad scientist bent on world domination.

...wait, that's six.

.....Oh, I counted Scilock, silly me.

.....wait.....SCILOCK?!

Max, your husband, seemed to be just chatting away and laughing with the council. How could he?! That's it. Full frontal attack!

"Stephanie?! What are you doing here?"

"Stopping you! YAAAAAAH!!!"

The fight was clearly won by one side.
1323311.title: THE ATTACK ON THE COUNCIL OF CHAOS

13233112.content:
Ok... so... the fight didnt turn out so good.

One Inch ran into a vent, Slipknot was almost immediately murdered by Tommy Guns, Felina was able to convert Righteous Fury over to not only the CoC, but also the lesbian side, and Killshark bit off the Animal Kid's head.

After beating you two and tying you up to a chair, you and Heavy Hitter are pretty boned. Scilock shows up, and starts to question you.

"You just had to show up didn't you. I try to show up to one reunion, and you're on my back."

"Where's Megan?!" Stephanie yelled.

"Right here," Scilock uttered, as he flicked an on-off switch, opening a panel infront of Heavy Hitter. A giant hand came from the hole, as Heavy Hitter screamed and screamed, pulling the ropes away, and twisting the hand around. It was then you heard a loud familiar cry. The hand was your daughter's. In his shock, you barely feel slight motion on your wrists, as Mr. One Inch slowly cuts your ropes, unknown to the Council, whom are able to neutralize Heavy Hitter, and dangle her above the panel. What do you do?
13233112.title: The Council of Chaos defeats the NWD.

132331122.content:
You quickly throw your hands forward, and yell "NIMBUS RODAH!" as a large gust of wind blows at the Council, knocking them to a wall. Heavy Hitter walks to you, and quickly tears off your rope. Its you, Heavy Hitter, and Mr. One Inch VS the seven members of the Council. Showtime.


Heavy Hitter steps forward, as Tommy Guns fires his hands. Hitter lifts her shirt up, as her large perturbing stomach bounces the bullets off. The bullets rebounded kill Righteous Fury and Jaws. Derby plunges his knife toward the stomach, only for it to bend. He tries to run away, only to trip on Mr. One Inch, and slip into he panel. You watch in horror as your now gigantic daughter devours Derby, who pleads for his life. This was Scilock's doing.

Tommy Guns, now empty, runs toward you. With lightning fast reflexes, you spinkick, causing him to twirl around, and fall into the panel. At least you were feeding your daughter. Camerahead Eddie, enticed by the gore taking lace, jumps forward, paying no attention to the mouth that surrounds the gore, and is eaten.

Felina and Scilock are the only ones remaining. Felina attempts to reason with Heavy Hitter, however her only response was to crush her muzzle into her skull, killing her. Heavy Hitter takes Scilock by the nape, and dangles him over the daughter, who begs for sustenance. You see your daughter's mouth drowned with the blood of three vicious murderers, and look back to Scilock, dangling over the mouth.
132331122.title: Cast a Quick Spell on the Council

choices: Follow the family on a camping trip...
1323311222.content:
"Drop him," you coldly order, shocking Mr. One Inch and Scilock. Heavy Hitter nods, and loosens her grip, allowing Scilock to fall into the jaw of his own daughter, where he is mauled by her grizzly chewing process. The adventure was over. The day was done.









You, now much older, knit a picture of the family tree, as you take a glance around the Thanksgiving table. You see sleazy Bob Thornton, with all his new botox implants. Still giant Megan, and her regular sized fiancee. Mr. One Inch, his regular sized wife and their basketball player son. Heavy Hitter, now a little larger, holding your hand and sitting by your side. What a nice family you've made for yourself.

Edit 30.12.2013
I had a very limited review the other day, which merely asked a question about a single thread that ended badly. As such, I have decided to put in a couple of rules.

In regard to additions:

I understand that some stories come to a close at their own pace, but do not end the story after only one chapter of it. The review that I speak of had found this dead end storyline. I have changed it, and will be looking through the rest of the story for any other areas where people have ended the story without letting it develop.

In regard to reviews and ratings:

While I am in favour of helpful reviews that help me to improve my own work and chapters, I am not in favour of people who give me a one or two star review and then justify it with one line, and a question at that. If you have a question about the story, please don't put it in a review, send me an email about it. Keep the reviews for constructive criticism on how to improve the story, or to tell me what you liked about it.

That's everything, please enjoy the story.
